How little he knew.

It thus came about that Nessa & I formed together a v a very close, conspiracy.During those years theIn that large house, the parties Even if we were silent about her affair with Jack, it was that was the only reserve we had. In that world of many men, we were the two coming & going, we formed the our private nucleus. There we were
alone, with father all day; in the evening, Adrian would come back from Westminster; then Jack from Lincolns Inn; then Gerald from Dents or Henrietta House; then George from the Post office or the Treasury. & in the holidays Thoby would Thoby would be at Clifton or at Cambridge.The staple day would be a day spent together. And therefore we made together a small world inside the big world. We had an alliance that was so knit together that everything w (with the exception of Jack perhaps) was seen from the same angle; by o & took its shape from our own vantage points. Very soon after Stella's death we had saw life as a perpetual struggle to make our get some kind of standing place for ourselves in this bewildering, bafflingb. always changing, almost always per d We were always battling for that which was always being interfered with, snuffled up, snatched away. I cannot understand the savage brutality.

Down came his fist on the account book. There was a roar. His vein filled. His face flushed. Then he shouted "I am ruined" – Then he This words were only Then he beat his breast.. He went through an extraordinary dramatisation of self pity anger & despair. He was ruined – dying... wantonly tortured by the wanton extravagance of Vanessa & Sophie.. Vanessa stood be by his side dumb. "And you stand there like a block of stone. Dont you pity me? Havent you a word to say to me?" & so on. Vanessa stood by his side absolutely dumb. He thr flung at her all the phrases of frenzy & sarcasm – about shooting Niagara & so on – that came handy. Still she remained static. Then Another attitude was adopted. With a deep groan he picked up his pen & with ostentatiously trembling fingers wrote out the cheque. This was wearily tossed to Vanessa. Slowly & with many groans the pen the account book were put away. Then he sank into his chair & sat with his head on his breast. And then at last, after glancing at a book for a, mo he woud would look up & say half plaintively. "And what are you doing this afternoon, Jinny?"
